intro: Didothion, commonly known as the golden groundsel, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that are clustered in a single head, resembling a dandelion. Didothion typically grows in open, sunny areas and is often found in grasslands and rocky soils. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological studies and horticultural cultivation.
